result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Gagliano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be terminated after 6 months if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim except as authorized/allowed by family court orders and civil (TRO) order.
Comply with all family court orders and temporary restraining orders.
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision.  Civil judgment entered for outstanding obligations.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: June 23, 2016 Jury Status Hearing filed by Joni Smith, Court Reporter.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony J Gagliano in court with Attorney Robert E Webb.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has paid restitution in full before court today.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Repeater enhancer is stricken, domestic abuse enhancer remains.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  Jessica G. makes statements.  Santos G. makes statements.  Rhonda L. makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Webb makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2: IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME 

TERM OF PROBATION:   9 MONTHS    *May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent*  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim except as authorized/allowed by family court orders and civil (TRO) order
____Comply with all family court orders and temporary restraining orders 
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha;

COSTS:  $343.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)
